subject: Communication
title: The Peak-End Rule in Stories
description: A quick win: understand The Peak-End Rule in Stories.

hook.text: You remember a movie by its best moment and its ending. The rest? A blur. That's the peak-end rule.

buildup.text: Daniel Kahneman discovered that we judge experiences by their peak intensity and their ending, not the average.

discovery.text: A story with a mediocre middle but a powerful climax and ending will be remembered as a great story.

twist.text: Conversely, a mostly great story with a weak ending will be remembered as disappointing â€” Game of Thrones proves this.

climax.text: Smart storytellers invest disproportionately in the peak moment and the closing line.

punchline.text: Nail the peak. Nail the end. The rest is forgiven.

quiz.question: What does Kahneman's peak-end rule say about how we judge experiences?
options: We judge by the peak moment and the ending
